pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b2edbf7fe8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19427/commits/b2edbf7fe87f7204bb372d969ca076a7e82fee9e)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FiniteType | 1845 | 1859 | +14 (+0.76%) |
| Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion | 1872 | 1883 | +11 (+0.59%) |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Noetherian | 1479 | 1483 | +4 (+0.27%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Noetherian` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Noetherian`|4|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.RationalMap` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.SpreadingOut` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ValuativeCriterion`</details>|10|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Finite` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Immersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Integral` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Proper` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UniversallyClosed` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.ProjectiveSpectrum.Proper`</details>|11|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.FiniteType`|14|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Fiber` (new file)|2028|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsFinite.finite_preimage_singleton`
`+ LocallyOfFiniteType.jacobsonSpace`
`+ QuasiCompact.isCompact_preimage_singleton`
`+ Scheme.Hom.asFiber`
`+ Scheme.Hom.discrete_fiber`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiber`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberHomeo`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberHomeo_apply`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberOverSpecResidueField`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberToSpecResidueField`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberToSpecResidueField_apply`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberŒπ`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberŒπ_asFiber`
`+ Scheme.Hom.fiberŒπ_fiberHomeo_symm`
`+ Scheme.Hom.finite_preimage`
`+ Scheme.Hom.range_fiberŒπ`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (y : Y) : IsPreimmersion (f.fiberŒπ y)`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (y : Y) [IsFinite f] : Finite (f.fiber y) := by`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) (y : Y) [LocallyOfFiniteType f] : JacobsonSpace (f.fiber y)`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) [IsAffineHom f] (y : Y) : IsAffine (f.fiber y)`
`+ instance (f : X ‚ü∂ Y) [QuasiCompact f] (y : Y) : CompactSpace (f.fiber y)`
`+ instance (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) : (f.fiber y).CanonicallyOver X where hom := f.fiberŒπ y`
`+ instance : DiscreteTopology (PrimeSpectrum R)`
`+ instance : Finite (PrimeSpectrum R)`
`+ instance {R : CommRingCat} [IsJacobsonRing R] : JacobsonSpace (Spec R)`
`+ instance {R} [CommRing R] [IsJacobsonRing R] : JacobsonSpace (Spec (.of R))`
`- isSurjectiveOnStalks_isLocalAtTarget`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by chrisflav.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12847295737/job/35823437756)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12847295737/job/35823437796)
Sorry, I forgot about this one.
Could you please add an instance `Scheme.Hom.fiberToField_isOver`?

```suggestion
def Scheme.Hom.fiberToSpecResidueField (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) : f.fiber y ‚ü∂ Spec (Y.residueField y) :=
  pullback.snd _ _
```
This is quite a long name, but we already have `fromSpecResidueField`.
There was a `(f.fiber y).CanonicallyOver X` already. Is that not the one you are thinking of?

No, I meant
```
instance (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) : (f.fiber y).Over (Spec (Y.residueField y)) where
  hom := f.fiberToSpecResidueField y
```

Ah I see. After thinking about it more, I'm not 100% sure if this will be useful though. At least I have yet to come up with an actually use case. And due to the easy-to-abuse nature of this typeclass, I am particularly wary about adding such instances.

Unless if you have a concrete application where this is needed; in that case I would happily add it.

No concrete application in mind yet. I could imagine though that we will have a bunch of lemmas for schemes over a field, e.g. closed points are dense or point is closed iff residue field is finite extension, that would apply for `[X.Over (Spec k)]`. Of course, these can also be stated with just a morphism to a field as an argument.
You could also just add it as a `def`. Then one can locally make it an instance.
Maybe also `Scheme.Hom.fiberHomeo_symm_fst_apply` is useful?
I'm not sure what this would say?

Sorry, the name was garbage. What I meant was the generalization of `Scheme.Hom.fiberŒπ_asFiber`:
```
@[simp]
lemma Scheme.Hom.fiberŒπ_fiberHomeo_symm (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) (x : f.base ‚Åª¬π' {y}) :
    (f.fiberŒπ y).base ((f.fiberHomeo y).symm x) = x :=
  congr($((f.fiberHomeo _).apply_symm_apply x).1)
```
Yeah this is useful. Thanks!
If its `inferInstance`, do we need it? Is it to speed up instance search?
Yes, because the instance it depends on is of low priority, and it is not straightforward to me that JacobsonSpace + Finite implies DiscreteTopology.

This seems to be a bug. I reduced it to this for now, but will investigate further:
```
import Mathlib.Tactic.WLOG

class Foo (X : Type) : Prop where

set_option trace.Meta.synthInstance true

example {X Y : Type} [Foo Y] : Foo X := by
  wlog hY : 3 = 3
  ¬∑ have : Foo Y := inferInstance
    sorry
  sorry
```
Could you replace your `why is this needed?` comments with `instance search is reaching maximum recursion depth without this`?

```suggestion
lemma Scheme.Hom.fiberHomeo_apply (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) (x : f.fiber y) :
```

```suggestion
lemma Scheme.Hom.fiberToSpecResidueField_apply (f : X.Hom Y) (y : Y) (x : f.fiber y) :
```
I don't understand these three lines. Could you explain?
I was trying to see what went wrong and forgot to remove them.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry): scheme-theoretic fibre
